titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Abraham Lincoln collection, 1847-1864

publicationstmt.publisher: The New York Public Library. Manuscripts and Archives Division.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

profiledesc.creation: EAD generated by archives.nypl.org on December 9, 2014

did.unittitle: Abraham Lincoln collection

repository.corpname: The New York Public Library. Manuscripts and Archives Division.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

did.abstract: Abraham Lincoln (1809-1865) was the sixteenth president of the U.S. Collection consists of original documents, photostats, facsimiles, and clippings concerning Lincoln. Papers include Lincoln's correspondence (some with generals in Union Army), notes, legal papers, military orders, and related items. Clippings are from newspapers and catalogs.

prefercite.p: Abraham Lincoln collection, Manuscripts and Archives Division, The New York Public Library

did.unittitle: Abraham Lincoln Papers
A. Original Manuscripts by Lincoln (in chronological order)
A. D folio (1 leaf). Deposition of Christian Goodman

Bill in chancery to Sangamon Co. Circuit Court, Illinois, Lincoln and Herndon as attorneys for Upton Crowl against John Grigg, David B. Ayers, Robert North, and William Parks. Affidavit sworn by Lincoln before J. Calhoun, clerk, and L. B. Adams
R. K. Webster against Gill & Rupert

scopecontent.p: Plea and notice filed April 9, 1852. Accompanying the document is a letter dated September 24, 1895 from Horace White to Mr. Eames; and a letter dated September 21, 1895 from Jesse W. Weik to Mr. White.

document signed, Original order suspending the writ of habeas corpus between New York and Washington. Countersigned by William Henry Seward

Letter, with envelope. To George Dad [...?] Written by John Hay under President Lincoln's direction

document signed, Commission to Henry C. Bowen as collector of taxes
Autograph endorsement signed

Document signed by the Governors of Ohio, Indiana, Iowa, and Wisconsin offering the Government 80,000 troops

scopecontent.p: With autograph acceptance by President Lincoln and by Secretary of War Stanton dated April 23, 1864.

letter signed, Abraham Lincoln to Mary L. Booth. The body of the letter is in handwriting of John Hay [EM #11708]

scopecontent.p: Autograph endorsement signed On verso of petition from "We the undersigned Union men". Countersigned by W. W. R [...?], clerk. A. note signed by J. B. [Henderson?] at bottom of page. Top portion of petition cut off. [Vol. #17].

letter signed, James Harlan To President Lincoln regarding appointment of Rev. Silas Rawson. Countersigned by A. Porter
James Harlan to President Lincoln transmitting application of Rev. Vernon for chaplain of Lawson Military Hospital

scopecontent.p: September 6, 1861 from John F. Potter to Lincoln requesting an army appointment for Mr. Helper of North Carolina.
